description: Metadata about restriction enzymes including type, reliability, and special considerations

Type_II.description: Classic restriction enzymes that cut at fixed positions within or near their recognition sequence
Type_II.cleavage: Cut at specific position within/near recognition site

Type_IIS.description: Enzymes that recognize asymmetric sequences and cut outside their recognition site, enabling Golden Gate assembly
Type_IIS.cleavage: Cut at defined distance outside recognition site (e.g., N bases downstream)
Type_IIS.note: Presence in insert or backbone can interfere with Golden Gate workflows

EcoRI.star_activity: Yes, at low salt or high glycerol
EcoRI.notes: One of the most commonly used enzymes. Very reliable. Palindromic site.

HindIII.notes: Workhorse enzyme. Palindromic. Standard 5' cloning site for GenScript AAV backbones.

XbaI.notes: Palindromic. Standard 3' cloning site for GenScript AAV backbones. Compatible with NheI and SpeI overhangs.

EcoRV.notes: Excellent blunt-end cutter. Palindromic. Used in pUC57 FLASH backbones.

BbvCI.notes: IMPORTANT: BbvCI is a STANDARD Type II enzyme, NOT Type IIS. It cuts within its recognition sequence, not outside. Non-palindromic. Less commonly used. May be confused with Type IIS enzymes due to similar naming convention.

BsaI.cut_site: GGTCTC(N)↓ (1 base into N region, creates 4-base 5' overhang)
BsaI.notes: Gold standard for Golden Gate. Highly reliable. Must be absent from both insert and backbone for successful Golden Gate. Non-palindromic.

BsmBI.cut_site: CGTCTC(N)↓ (1 base into N region, creates 4-base 5' overhang)
BsmBI.notes: Essentially identical to Esp3I. Reliable Type IIS enzyme. Non-palindromic.

BbsI.cut_site: GAAGAC(NN)↓ (2 bases into N region, creates 4-base 5' overhang)
BbsI.notes: CRITICAL FINDING: Present in ALL pGS-AAV backbones just downstream of 3' ITR (see backbone catalog). Position varies by ITR type but consistently present. This makes these backbones incompatible with BbsI-based Golden Gate assembly without modification. Non-palindromic.

Esp3I.cut_site: CGTCTC(N)↓ (1 base into N region, creates 4-base 5' overhang)
Esp3I.notes: Identical recognition and cleavage to BsmBI. Enzyme choice is commercial/availability preference. Non-palindromic.

SapI.cut_site: GCTCTTC(N)↓ (1 base into N region, creates 3-base 5' overhang)

PaqCI.cut_site: CACCTGC(NNNN)↓ on top strand, (NNNNNNNN)↓ on bottom strand (asymmetric)
PaqCI.notes: IMPORTANT: PaqCI IS a Type IIS enzyme. Creates asymmetric overhangs (4 bases on top strand, 8 bases on bottom). Less commonly used than BsaI/BsmBI. Non-palindromic.

NotI.notes: 8-base recognition site makes it very rare (cuts ~once per 65kb). Palindromic. Useful for large constructs.

PstI.notes: Palindromic. Dam methylation (GATC within recognition site: CTGATCAG variant) blocks cutting. Associated with Rep68 splice acceptor region in AAV2.

SalI.notes: Palindromic. Overhangs compatible with XhoI (can ligate together).

XhoI.notes: Palindromic. Overhangs compatible with SalI (can ligate together).

very_high.description: Consistently performs well, minimal optimization needed

high.description: Generally reliable with occasional need for optimization

medium.description: May require optimization or have specific conditions

low.description: Fussy or unreliable, use alternatives when possible

fussy_enzymes.description: Enzymes that require special consideration or may be unreliable (DESIGN-004)

enzymes.name: BbvCI
issues: Less commonly used, may have activity issues
Often confused as Type IIS but is actually Type II
Non-palindromic recognition makes it less versatile
enzymes.recommendations: Avoid if possible. Use more reliable alternatives (EcoRI, HindIII, etc.)

enzymes.name: PaqCI
issues: Asymmetric overhang creation can be complex
enzymes.recommendations: Use BsaI or BsmBI for standard Golden Gate instead

enzymes.name: SmaI
issues: Blunt cutter, but activity can be temperature-sensitive
CpG content in recognition site (CCCGGG) can affect methylation
enzymes.recommendations: Use EcoRV for more reliable blunt-end cloning

methylation_blocking.description: Dam and Dcm methylation in E. coli can block certain restriction enzymes

affected_enzymes: XbaI (TCTAGA contains overlapping GATC in some contexts)
EcoRI (can be affected if GATC overlaps)
Dam_methylation.solution: Use Dam- E. coli strain (e.g., JM110, SCS110) or CutSmart enzymes (methylation-insensitive variants)

affected_enzymes: Some enzymes with CCWGG in recognition site
Dcm_methylation.solution: Use Dcm- E. coli strain or avoid affected enzymes

compatible_pairs.notes: Can ligate together, but recreates neither site
Can ligate together, recreates neither site

golden_gate_best_practices.description: Guidelines for Golden Gate assembly with Type IIS enzymes

enzyme_selection.acceptable: BbsI (if BsaI sites unavoidable), SapI (for 3-base overhangs)
enzyme_selection.avoid: PaqCI (unless specifically needed for asymmetric overhangs)

pGS_AAV_series.BbsI: INCOMPATIBLE - all pGS-AAV backbones contain BbsI site downstream of 3' ITR
pGS_AAV_series.note: For BbsI-based Golden Gate with pGS-AAV, must remove BbsI site from backbone first (non-trivial)

pUC57_FLASH_series.note: Explicitly designed for Golden Gate compatibility

insert_design.rule_1: Insert must NOT contain internal Type IIS sites for the enzyme being used
insert_design.rule_2: Add Type IIS sites at termini with desired overhangs (e.g., 5'-BsaI-[4bp overhang]-insert-[4bp overhang]-BsaI-3')
insert_design.rule_3: Overhang design: use unique 4bp sequences, avoid palindromes, check for mispriming
insert_design.rule_4: Remove internal Type IIS sites via silent mutations if in coding region (Checkpoint 8)

BUG_003_related.lesson: Always count restriction sites on BOTH strands
BUG_003_related.enzymes_affected: All palindromic enzymes (most Type II enzymes)
BUG_003_related.implementation: For palindromic sites, each occurrence in sequence represents a site on both strands. For non-palindromic, search both forward strand and reverse complement.

DESIGN_001_related.lesson: Verify cloning site uniqueness in FINAL construct (backbone + insert), not just insert alone
DESIGN_001_related.enzymes_affected: HindIII, XbaI (for AAV cloning); EcoRV (for FLASH cloning)
DESIGN_001_related.implementation: Checkpoint 9 must check uniqueness in full assembled plasmid

DESIGN_004_related.lesson: Avoid fussy or poorly characterized enzymes
DESIGN_004_related.recommendation: Stick to well-established, highly reliable enzymes (EcoRI, HindIII, BamHI, XbaI, BsaI, BsmBI)

Type_IIS_confusion.lesson: Correctly classify enzymes as Type II vs Type IIS
common_mistakes: BbvCI is Type II, NOT Type IIS (cuts within recognition site)
PaqCI IS Type IIS (cuts outside recognition site)
Type_IIS_confusion.verification: Type IIS enzymes cut OUTSIDE their recognition sequence. Type II cut within or immediately adjacent.
